comments:
Eclipse version 3.2.0, build ID M20060921-0945
OS - Linux
jdk 1.5.0

We develop the Subversive plugin and the next error report was recieved:
http://community.polarion.org/polarion/portal/perspective/projects/page/tracker.psml/js_pane/preview/project/Subversive?webobjectid=Subversive-SBV-2640&layout=clear

Obviously, the error has happenned while refreshing the resource tree and is connected with linked resources. Here is an extract from the stack trace:

java.lang.NullPointerException 
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.getStore(FileSystemResourceManager.java:353)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.getStore(Resource.java:1066)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.UnifiedTree.createChildForLinkedResource(UnifiedTree.java:238)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.UnifiedTree.addChildren(UnifiedTree.java:144)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.UnifiedTree.addNodeChildrenToQueue(UnifiedTree.java:210)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.UnifiedTree.accept(UnifiedTree.java:94)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.refreshResource(FileSystemResourceManager.java:726)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.refresh(FileSystemResourceManager.java:710)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal(Resource.java:1400)
at org.polarion.team.svn.core.operation.local.RefreshResourcesOperation$1.run(RefreshResourcesOperation.java:101)
..................

Note, that FileSystemResourceManager.getStore() function contains the next code: 

public IFileStore getStore(IResource target) {
      return getStoreRoot(target).createStore(target.getFullPath());
}

So, NullPointerException can be thrown if target points to null or the getStoreRoot(target) function returns null. The code investigations make it clear that target is not null, otherwise this function would never be called, so we come to conclusion that getStoreRoot(target) function returned null, which doesn't agree with it's description:

/**
  * Returns the file store root for the provided resource. Never returns null.
  */
 private FileStoreRoot getStoreRoot(IResource target) {
        .......
}

Best regards,
Elena Matokhina
Subversive Team
Looks like the NPE is coming from the Resources plug-in.

This is a known bug but of unknown cause... if you could pass this along to the user who reported it: we're actively looking for a reproducible test case, and also want to know if anyone can reproduce on any 3.3 milestone build.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 144499 ***

(In reply to comment #2)
> This is a known bug but of unknown cause... if you could pass this along to the
> user who reported it: we're actively looking for a reproducible test case, and
> also want to know if anyone can reproduce on any 3.3 milestone build.
> *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 144499 ***

Unfortunately, there were no user contacts and comments specified in the error report. We've tried to reproduce the problem, but failed. If there is any additional info about this bug I'll let you know.

Best regards, 
Elena Matokhina
Subversive Team
